pageTitle: West Bromwich Albion - New Manager Search Steps Up A Gear
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {10325=Pulis Gives Lambert Update (Thursday July 30 2015), 21822=The media are awash today with rumours suggesting that Dan Ashworth has already held talks with Claudio Ranieri. The E&S, amongst others, say that Ashworth met with the 60 year old Italian last week as the club work through a shortlist of those best suited to replace Roy Hodgson. It's also suggested that Ranieri, via his agent, made the first move to get in touch. They say the club are hopeful of having a new appointment before the end of May, but that there are other interviews lined up as the Baggies assess our options. Other expected candidates include Chris Hughton who was interviewed prior to Roy's appointment, and having impressed back then, depending how his future looks with Birmingham, it's suggested he will be a strong frontrunner if he becomes an option. Alan Curbishley is also being touted as being in the frame for the short list. Vital West Brom on: Vital West Brom on:, 11293=Slade Confirms West Brom Interest In Marshall (Saturday August 1 2015), 18239=Date:Tuesday May 8 2012, 9557=Audio - No Berahino Concerns For Pulis (Wednesday July 29 2015), 18198=Time: 7:00PM, 11086=Friendly - Bristol Rovers 0-4 Albion (Saturday August 1 2015), 10139=Brunt Pleased With Pre Season So Far (Thursday July 30 2015), 9942=Chester Completes Move - No Diaby (Wednesday July 29 2015), 10889=Two Games Selected For TV (Friday July 31 2015), 10522=Audio - Fletcher On Berahino Price Tag (Friday July 31 2015), 9748=Friendly - Walsall 0-2 Albion (Wednesday July 29 2015), 10705=Lambert Makes Albion Move (Friday July 31 2015)}
